channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-6113] Problem with container-edit-jvm-options
item.description:
After issuing the 'container-edit-jvm-options' to update JVM options on remote ssh container, the root container loses control of the ssh container. For example, after you edit/update the JVM options and stopping the ssh container, the container cannot be restarted. See the attached 'testoutput.txt' to view the console output from a test run. This seems to only occur after one invokes the 'container-edit-jvm-options' command to edit the options. Invoking the command with -f to get current set of options does not have any negative effect.

The log shows the following:

2016-09-16 10:40:44,853 | INFO  | l Console Thread | FabricServiceImpl                | 142 - io.fabric8.fabric-core - 1.2.0.redhat-621117 | Starting container ssh1
 
2016-09-16 10:42:46,924 | INFO  | l Console Thread | ContainerEditJvmOptionsAction    | 38 - org.apache.karaf.shell.console - 2.4.0.redhat-621117 | Updated JVM flags for container ssh1
 
2016-09-16 10:42:46,925 | INFO  | cache-1-thread-1 | ZkDataStoreImpl                  | 142 - io.fabric8.fabric-core - 1.2.0.redhat-621117 | Event CHILD_UPDATED detected on /fabric/registry/containers/config/ssh1/metadata with data . Sending notification.
 
2016-09-16 10:43:09,008 | INFO  | l Console Thread | FabricServiceImpl                | 142 - io.fabric8.fabric-core - 1.2.0.redhat-621117 | Stopping container ssh1
 
2016-09-16 10:44:39,682 | INFO  | l Console Thread | FabricServiceImpl                | 142 - io.fabric8.fabric-core - 1.2.0.redhat-621117 | Starting container ssh1
 
2016-09-16 10:46:01,229 | ERROR | l Console Thread | ContainerEditJvmOptionsAction    | 38 - org.apache.karaf.shell.console - 2.4.0.redhat-621117 | Unable to connect to JMX Server
 
java.io.IOException: Failed to retrieve RMIServer stub: javax.naming.ServiceUnavailableException [Root exception is java.rmi.ConnectException: Connection refused to host: joeferna.remote.csb; nested exception is:
 
        java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused]
 
        at javax.management.remote.rmi.RMIConnector.connect(RMIConnector.java:369)[:1.8.0_60]

So it seems that updating the JVM flags somehow precludes connection from being made to ssh container's machine.

I restarted the root container, enabled DEBUG, and tried to start the ssh container. Still could not start ssh container. See attached fuse.log file.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
